N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 111.6 - Tuition and waiver of tuition

State Regulations
(a) The rate of tuition for each school shall
be determined as follows. The amount of State funds specifically provided for
the operation of each school shall be subtracted from the total actual costs of
the operation for such school. The difference shall then be divided by the
total number of students in the school. (b) Waivers of tuition may be awarded by the
executive director with the approval of the advisory council on the basis of
need from State monies specifically allocated to each school for tuition
waivers. The amount of tuition waiver for each student shall be determined by
committees convened by the executive director with the approval of the advisory
council. The executive director may require such information as is necessary to
make a determination of need. Notes
